eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding package

Submodules

eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.common module

This module provides the LOCAL_DATA_PIPELINE class, which extends the pipeline configuration to handle local data paths for both data reading and inference components.

class eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.common.LOCAL_DATA_PIPELINE

Bases: object

Pipeline class that configures data paths for local storage.

This class overrides the configure_pipeline method to replace data and inference component configurations with local paths.

configure_pipeline(model_config, resume_from, local_path)

Configures the pipeline to use local data paths.

Parameters:

  • model_config – The configuration object for the model.

  • resume_from – The checkpoint or state to resume from.

  • local_path (str) – The path to local data directory.

Returns:

The updated pipeline configuration.

eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.object_detection module

Module for object detection configuration classes.

This module provides example user-defined configuration classes for object detection tasks. In order to define a new configuration, create a class that directly or indirectly inherits from ExperimentConfig and implement the configure_pipeline method. You can also inherit from one of the existing user-defined classes and override the necessary attributes to reduce the amount of code you need to write.

These user-defined configuration classes are used to define the desired pipeline, which can include any number of components. Available component options can be found in the core module. Pass the name of the class to the main.py script to run the pipeline.

class eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.object_detection.OBJECT_DETECTION_PAIRS_LOCAL_PIPELINE(exp_logdir=None, **kwargs)

Bases: LOCAL_DATA_PIPELINE, OBJECT_DETECTION_PAIRS_PIPELINE

Local pipeline for object detection pairs condition.

This class combines LOCAL_DATA_PIPELINE and OBJECT_DETECTION_PAIRS_PIPELINE, allowing for local data paths.

configure_pipeline(model_config, resume_from=None)

Configure and return the local pipeline for object detection pairs.

Parameters:

  • model_config – The model configuration to be used.

  • resume_from (str, optional) – Path to resume training from. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The configured local pipeline.

Return type:

PipelineConfig

class eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.object_detection.OBJECT_DETECTION_PAIRS_PIPELINE(exp_logdir=None, **kwargs)

Bases: ExperimentConfig

ExperimentConfig pipeline for the object detection (pairs condition).

This class defines a pipeline for object detection on pairs of objects. There is no default model configuration; the model configuration must be passed in via the command line.

data_processing_comp

Configuration for data processing.

Type:

PromptProcessingConfig

inference_comp

Configuration for inference.

Type:

InferenceConfig

evalreporting_comp

Configuration for evaluation and reporting.

Type:

EvalReportingConfig

configure_pipeline(model_config, resume_from=None)

Configure and return the pipeline.

Parameters:

  • model_config – The model configuration to be used.

  • resume_from (str, optional) – Path to resume training from. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The configured pipeline, consisting of data processing, inference, and evaluation/reporting components.

Return type:

PipelineConfig

class eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.object_detection.OBJECT_DETECTION_SINGLE_LOCAL_PIPELINE(exp_logdir=None, **kwargs)

Bases: LOCAL_DATA_PIPELINE, OBJECT_DETECTION_SINGLE_PIPELINE

This class combines LOCAL_DATA_PIPELINE and OBJECT_DETECTION_SINGLE_PIPELINE, allowing for local data paths.

Configure and return the local pipeline for single object detection.

  • resume_from (str, optional) – Path to resume training from. Defaults to None.

Returns:

class eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.object_detection.OBJECT_DETECTION_SINGLE_PIPELINE(exp_logdir=None, **kwargs)

Bases: OBJECT_DETECTION_PAIRS_PIPELINE

ExperimentConfig pipeline for single object detection condition.

This class extends OBJECT_DETECTION_PAIRS_PIPELINE to use the single object condition instead of pairs.

configure_pipeline(model_config, resume_from=None)

Configure and return the pipeline using the single object condition.

Parameters:

  • model_config – The model configuration to be used.

  • resume_from (str, optional) – Path to resume training from. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The configured pipeline with the single object condition.

Return type:

PipelineConfig

eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.object_recognition module

Example user-defined configuration classes for the object recognition task.

In order to define a new configuration, a new class must be created that directly or indirectly inherits from ExperimentConfig, and the configure_pipeline method should be implemented. You can inherit from one of the existing user-defined classes below and override the necessary attributes to reduce the amount of code you need to write.

The user-defined configuration classes are used to define your desired pipeline that can include any number of components. Find component options in the core module.

Pass the name of the class to the main.py script to run the pipeline.

class eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.object_recognition.OBJECT_RECOGNITION_PAIRS_LOCAL_PIPELINE(exp_logdir=None, **kwargs)

Bases: LOCAL_DATA_PIPELINE, OBJECT_RECOGNITION_PAIRS_PIPELINE

Defines a local pipeline for the object recognition pairs condition.

configure_pipeline(model_config, resume_from=None)

Configures the pipeline for the local data scenario (pairs condition).

Parameters:

  • model_config (dict) – The model configuration dictionary.

  • resume_from (str, optional) – Path to resume from a previous checkpoint. Defaults to None.

  • local_path (str, optional) – Path to the local data. Inherited from LOCAL_DATA_PIPELINE.

Returns:

A pipeline configuration instance.

Return type:

PipelineConfig

class eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.object_recognition.OBJECT_RECOGNITION_PAIRS_PIPELINE(exp_logdir=None, **kwargs)

Bases: ExperimentConfig

Defines an ExperimentConfig pipeline for the object recognition dataset (pairs condition).

There is no model_config by default, and the model config must be passed in via command line.

configure_pipeline(model_config, resume_from=None)

Configures the pipeline for the object recognition pairs condition.

Parameters:

  • model_config (dict) – The model configuration dictionary.

  • resume_from (str, optional) – Path to resume from a previous checkpoint. Defaults to None.

Returns:

A pipeline configuration instance.

Return type:

PipelineConfig

Bases: LOCAL_DATA_PIPELINE, SPATIAL_REASONING_PAIRS_PIPELINE

Defines a local data variant of the SPATIAL_REASONING_PAIRS_PIPELINE.

configure_pipeline(model_config, resume_from=None)

Configures the pipeline for local data in the pairs condition.

Parameters:

  • model_config – The model configuration to be used by the Inference component.

  • resume_from – Checkpoint or step to resume from, if any. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The pipeline configuration using local data for pairs condition.

Return type:

PipelineConfig

class eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.spatial_reasoning.SPATIAL_REASONING_PAIRS_PIPELINE(exp_logdir=None, **kwargs)

Bases: ExperimentConfig

Defines an ExperimentConfig pipeline for the spatial reasoning dataset (pairs condition).

This class creates a pipeline without a default model_config. The model_config must be passed in via the command line.

configure_pipeline(model_config, resume_from=None)

Configures the pipeline components for data processing, inference, and evaluation.

Parameters:

  • model_config – The model configuration to be used by the Inference component.

  • resume_from – Checkpoint or step to resume from, if any. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The configuration containing the sequence of pipeline components.

Return type:

PipelineConfig

eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.visual_prompting module

class eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.visual_prompting.VISUAL_PROMPTING_PAIRS_LOCAL_PIPELINE(exp_logdir=None, **kwargs)

Bases: LOCAL_DATA_PIPELINE, VISUAL_PROMPTING_PAIRS_PIPELINE

Pipeline for visual prompting pairs in a local environment.

Uses a local path for data and inherits from LOCAL_DATA_PIPELINE and VISUAL_PROMPTING_PAIRS_PIPELINE.

configure_pipeline(model_config, resume_from=None)

Configures the pipeline for local visual prompting pairs data.

Parameters:

  • model_config (Any) – The model configuration to use.

  • resume_from (Optional[str]) – If specified, a path from which to resume. Defaults to None.

  • local_path (str) – Local data path (injected by super call).

Returns:

The configured pipeline including data processing, inference, and evaluation components.

Return type:

PipelineConfig

class eureka_ml_insights.user_configs.image_understanding.visual_prompting.VISUAL_PROMPTING_PAIRS_PIPELINE(exp_logdir=None, **kwargs)

Bases: ExperimentConfig

Defines an ExperimentConfig pipeline for the visual prompting dataset (pairs condition).

There is no model_config by default, so the model config must be passed in via the command line.

data_processing_comp

Data processing component.

Type:

PromptProcessingConfig

inference_comp

Inference component.

Type:

InferenceConfig

evalreporting_comp

Evaluation and reporting component.

Type:

EvalReportingConfig

configure_pipeline(model_config, resume_from=None)

Configures the pipeline components for the visual prompting pairs condition.

Parameters:

  • model_config (Any) – The model configuration to use.

  • resume_from (Optional[str]) – If specified, a path from which to resume. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The configured pipeline including data processing, inference, and evaluation components.

Return type:

PipelineConfig
